Posts.Content: What results have members had...eg 1 year...2 years...3 years. Mine is 1.0 at 2 years. Did reach 10 prior to bacchy. I believe that zero is not achievable due to remaing prostate tissue.
Posts.Title: Forum users PSA results post Bracchy?

Posts.Content: What results have members had...eg 1 year...2 years...3 years. Mine is 1.0 at 2 years. Did reach 10 prior to bacchy. I believe that zero is not achievable due to remaing prostate tissue.
Posts.Title: Forum users PSA results post Bracchy?

Posts.Content: It is now 12 weeks post Brachy...still experiencing frequency and burning especially of an evening. The radiation dose should have peaked by now. When will I return to some normality of urinary function. How have other forum members managed.
Posts.Title: Recovery time after Brachytheraphy Iodide Seeding?

Posts.Content: I am still suffering from urinary frequency and urgency 14 months post bracchytheraphy. I take flowmax, but that only helps with the urine flow. Has anyone taken any medication or natural remedy that is effective?
Posts.Title: Any Medication for Urgency & Frequency?

Posts.Content: I was using Vesicare earlier post Bracchy, but I do not think it is worth taking on a regular basis. Radiation from the seeds should have stopped by now. I figure that the radiation may have damaged my urethra or the urination sensory area. Seeing my Urologist next month...will see what he says.
Posts.Title: Any Medication for Urgency & Frequency?

Posts.Content: What is the average time to return to reasonable normality after seed implants. 3 months...6 months...12 months??
Posts.Title: How long after Brachytheraphy for normal bladder function to return?

Posts.Content: Now 11 weeks post Iodine seed placement. Still suffering dysuria and frequency,especially of an evening. From what John T says, I should be improving soon.
Posts.Title: How long after Brachytheraphy for normal bladder function to return?

Posts.Content: I am 3 weeks post Brachytheraphy...Taking 1 tablet 4mg of flowmaxtra every morning. My problem is that of an evening and overnight, I experience more pain when urinating and frequency...up every 1.5 to 2 hours overnight...very poor stream...burning. Has anyone taken more than a single dose of flowmaxtra daily. I am thinking of taking one extra at 6pm to see if the extra dosage helps.
Posts.Title: Symptoms after Brachytheraphy...help.

Posts.Content: For those who have had brachy...how long after the procedure did it take to get back to normal urination....ie. no dysuria,frequency, urgency.....6 months?, 12 months?, longer?
Posts.Title: Post Brachytheraphy

Posts.Content: Nearly 6 months...still experiencing mild dysuria,urgency and frequency.
Posts.Title: Post Brachytheraphy

Posts.Content: Thanks for the info.....very informative.
Posts.Title: 10 months post Bracchytheraphy..PSA 1.1..is this OK?

Posts.Content: Prior to my bracchytheraphy, my PSA was about 11. Should I expect a lower reading at 10 mths post bracchy ?
Posts.Title: 10 months post Bracchytheraphy..PSA 1.1..is this OK?

Posts.Content: I've had Brachy August 2012 and my experience post Brachy has been.... Perineal discomfort was only for a short time, nothing to worry about. Even though you get told by the medical specialists that Brachy is extremely accurate in placing the seeds into the prostate gland, that is not guaranteed. Be aware that you may have ongoing problems post Brachy. Dysuria was a problem for me in the early stages post Brachy. I take Flowmax which I could not manage without. I experience ongoing urgency and frequency that I did not have pre Brachy. This certainly effects my quality of life. Have to be aware of the next toilet situation. At times I wonder if it was worthwhile, bit I think to myself if I did not have treatment for the cancer I could be much worse off. If I had to choose between Brachy and surgery again, I would still opt for Brachy because of less risk of post op complications.

Posts.Title: Brachy side affects after treament

Posts.Content: That I would experience urinary frequency, urgency and poor flow for such a long time after bracchy.[ Now nearly 12 months] Flomax does help with the urine flow. I was probably expecting/hoping that my urinary function would return to somewhere near my pre bracchy normality. However, I am happy that I made the choice of bracchy. This has been my situation, others may have had a better outcome. Ask your specialists prior to your bracchy about realistic outcomes, I was more concerned with stopping the cancer than the after effects of the bracchy..

Posts.Title: What I Need to Know About TWO TYPES of Brachytherapy

Posts.Content: What is the average length of time for being on Flomax. I am now 7 months post Bracchy and still need it for manageable urination.
Posts.Title: Flomax post Bracchytheraphy

Posts.Content: GP confirms urine infection...now on anti-biotics. I am reasonably OK during the day while I am standing and walking around. While sitting on our lounge chair watching TV of an evening, I find that I get the urgency feeling to urinate about every 30 minutes...painful slow urination over a 2 minute period. Does anyone have an answer to why this occurs.
Posts.Title: Problems after Brachytheraphy....help please.

Posts.Content: Currently aking 2 flowmax 400mcg daily, increase from 1 about 3 weeks ago...plus 2 ibuprofen daily for about a week. Had post brachy CT with a catheter in situ 10 days ago. For about 2 hours after I was passing blood, that resolved soon after, but some perineal discomfort has remained. Most pain and especially frequency occurs in the evening when I am sitting on the couch watching TV....takes about 2 minutes for the burning type pain to go away while micturating..from nothing to dribble to slight stream. Seeing my GP today to check for possible bladder infection...although I think that part of my problem is mechanical due to inflamation of the urethra being irradiated by the seeds. I have passed 2 seeds that I am aware of. One of which was noted on the op report as being seen protruding into the bladder. I have an appointment with the radiation oncologist that did my brachy in 2 weeks.
Posts.Title: Problems after Brachytheraphy....help please.

Posts.Content: Now 6 weeks post seeding...still experiencing frequency, at least 20 times per 24 hours, up 5 times overnight, very poor to moderate stream, burning, urgency etc...have passed 2 seeds that I am aware of. Is this normal....when can I expect improvement....what have other guys experienced.
Posts.Title: Problems after Brachytheraphy....help please.

Posts.Content: Hi wish full. The following is my own personal opinion. Your particular situation obviously depends on what stage your cancer is at. There are a lot more people on this forum with greater knowledge than me. Once I had decided on having treatment....the choice is between surgery and bracchytheraphy, I chose bracchy because it is less invasive and the risks of complications are less. Post bracchy I have experienced urgency, frequency, dysuria and poor stream. I currently take Flomax which helps with alleviating the problems. I often think, did I make the right decision in having treatment, but then I think that I could be much worse off if I ended up with cancer spreading to other areas of my body. The question to ask yourself and your doctor is....what are the consequences in not having any treatment versus lifestyle post treatment.
Posts.Title: Brachytherrapy any advice
